Data.event_text: Anjali Singh is killed while riding her scooter in Delhi.

links.text: -"Anjali Singh: The woman who was dragged to death in Delhi's hit-and-run case". BBC News. 2023-01-04. Retrieved 2023-01-06.-

Data.event_text: Kashmir conflict Four civilians are killed and six others injured when two terrorists open fire against Hindu people's homes in Rajouri district, Jammu and Kashmir.

links.text: -"Rajouri attack: Terrorists barged into Hindu homes, opened fire after confirming identity". India Today. 2 January 2023. Retrieved 2023-01-03.-

Data.event_text: Protests are reported in some parts of Jammu and Kashmir in response to the previous day's quadruple killing.

links.text: -"Rajouri: Tension in Kashmir after five killed". BBC. Retrieved 2 January 2022.-

Data.event_text: The Supreme Court of India upholds the legality of the government's decision to demonetise all ₹500 and ₹1,000 banknotes of the Mahatma Gandhi Series in 2016.

links.text: -"India's top court upholds legality of 2016 currency ban". AP NEWS. 2023-01-02. Retrieved 2023-01-03.-

Data.event_text: Rajouri attacks Two children are killed and four other people are injured by an explosion outside the home of one of the four Hindus who were killed.

links.text: -Ashiq, Peerzada (2023-01-02). "J&K Rajouri | Two killed, four injured in Dangri village blast". The Hindu. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 2023-01-03.-
-Ashiq, Peerzada (2023-01-02). "J&K Rajouri | Two killed, four injured in Dangri village blast". The Hindu. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 2023-01-03.-

Data.event_text: 4 January  The Competition Commission of India rejects an appeal from Google over its ruling in October that Google's dominant position in the search engine market and control of the Android app store violated India's antitrust laws.

links.text: -Chaturvedi, Arpan (2023-01-04). "India tribunal declines Google's request to block Android antitrust ruling". Reuters. Retrieved 2023-01-05.-

Data.event_text: 9 January  The historic Shahi Masjid in Saidabad area of Prayagraj, Uttar Pradesh, is demolished as part of a road-widening project.

links.text: -maniyar, zahid (2023-01-17). "Another historic mosque being bulldozed in UP". CJP. Retrieved 2024-12-17.-

Data.event_text: 1329 January  2023 Men's FIH Hockey World Cup

18 January  Several Indian wrestlers, most notably Bajrang Punia, Vinesh Phogat and Sakshi Malik, protest at the Jantar Mantar, New Delhi against the Wrestling Federation of India (WFI). Vinesh Phogat accused WFI president Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh of sexual harassment.

links.text: -"Wrestlers say protest against Wrestling Federation of India will continue until demands are met". India Today. 18 January 2023.-

Data.event_text: 26 February  Manish Sisodia, Deputy Chief Minister of Delhi is arrested by the Central Bureau of Investigation in liquor policy case.

links.text: -Dixit, Pranav (2023-02-26). "AAP's Manish Sisodia arrested by CBI in Delhi liquor policy case". Business Today (India). Retrieved 2023-02-26.-

Data.event_text: 28 February  Manish Sisodia and Satyendra Jain resign from their ministerial positions following the arrests.

links.text: -"Delhi News Live Updates: Arrested AAP ministers Manish Sisodia, Satyendar Jain resign from Delhi cabinet". The Indian Express. 2023-02-26. Retrieved 2023-02-28.-

Data.event_text: 2 March  Election results are declared for legislative assembly elections in three states; the BJP retains Tripura and Nagaland and hung assembly on Meghalaya.

links.text: -Karmakar, Rahul (2023-03-02). "BJP and allies retain power in Tripura, Nagaland; hung verdict in Meghalaya". The Hindu. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 2024-06-29.-
-Karmakar, Rahul (2023-03-02). "BJP and allies retain power in Tripura, Nagaland; hung verdict in Meghalaya". The Hindu. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 2024-06-29.-

Data.event_text: 18 March  Punjab Police initiated a crackdown against the "Waris Punjab De", a Punjab-based organisation, headed by radical Khalistan separatist, Amritpal Singh, arresting 78 persons and detaining several others for questioning. The eventual number of arrests was reported as 112.
2324 March  Rahul Gandhi is disqualified as a member of parliament in the Lok Sabha after being found guilty of defamation by the Surat court. Gandhi was subsequently sentenced to two years in jail.

links.text: -"Rahul Gandhi disqualified by Parliament after conviction in 'Modi surname' case". Livemint. 2023-03-24. Retrieved 2023-03-24.-

Data.event_text: 31 March  Indore stepwell collapse Thirty-six people are killed and 17 others are injured when a stepwell collapses during prayers at a Hindu temple in Indore, Madhya Pradesh.

links.text: -Dhillon, Amrit (2023-03-31). "Thirty-six dead after floor of Indian temple collapses". The Guardian. ISSN 0261-3077. Retrieved 2023-04-07.-
-Dhillon, Amrit (2023-03-31). "Thirty-six dead after floor of Indian temple collapses". The Guardian. ISSN 0261-3077. Retrieved 2023-04-07.-

Data.event_text: 1 April  A new income tax law comes into effect. It is a significant change on the old 1961 statute, and contains a controversial "angel tax" provision seeking to capture some of the income entering the country from foreign investors funding India's start-ups.

links.text: -"India's Angel Tax Spreads its Wings Over Nonresident Investors". news.bloombergtax.com. 17 February 2023. Retrieved 2023-04-10.-

Data.event_text: 4 April  Seven people are killed and eleven others are injured in an avalanche in Nathu La, Sikkim.

links.text: -"Avalanche sweeps away tourists in northeast India; 7 killed". AP NEWS. 2023-04-04. Retrieved 2023-04-10.-

Data.event_text: 12 April  Four soldiers are killed in a mass shooting incident at a military base in Punjab. Authorities say the shooting is not terror-related.

links.text: -"Four soldiers killed in shooting at Indian army base in Punjab". www.aljazeera.com. Retrieved 2023-04-12.-

Data.event_text: 15 April  Twelve people are killed and 28 others are injured when a bus falls into a gorge in Raigad, Maharashtra.

links.text: -Excelsior, Daily (2023-04-15). "12 killed, 28 injured after bus falls into gorge in Maharashtra's Raigad". Jammu Kashmir Latest News | Tourism | Breaking News J&K. Retrieved 2023-04-15.-

Data.event_text: 15 April  Gangster Atique Ahmed and his brother and gangster Ashraf Ahmed killed in a shootout in Prayagraj.

links.text: -"Atiq Ahmad, his brother Ashraf shot dead in Prayagraj, 3 attackers arrested". Hindustan Times. 2023-04-15. Retrieved 2023-04-15.-

Data.event_text: 23 April  Radical Khalistan separatist, Amritpal Singh is arrested following his surrender after the gurudwara, in which he was surrounded by police forces in Moga, Punjab. He was then sent to Dibrugarh central jail in Assam under NSA.

links.text: -"'Waris Punjab De' chief Amritpal Singh arrested from Punjab's Moga in joint operation; sent to Assam's Dibrugarh jail". TheHindu. 23 April 2023. Archived from the original on 23 April 2023. Retrieved 23 April 2023.-

-"'Waris Punjab De' chief Amritpal Singh arrested from Punjab's Moga in joint operation; sent to Assam's Dibrugarh jail". TheHindu. 23 April 2023. Archived from the original on 23 April 2023. Retrieved 23 April 2023.-

Data.event_text: 3 May  2023 Manipur violence Ethnic violence breaks out between Kuki and Meitei communities in the state of Manipur. At least 73 people are killed.
1013 May   The Indian National Congress won the 2023 Karnataka Legislative Assembly election by getting 135 out of 224 seats.

links.text: -"Karnataka election results: Congress wins by biggest vote share in 34 years". Hindustan Times. 2023-05-13. Retrieved 2023-05-14.-

Data.event_text: 19 May  Reserve Bank of India announced that it will withdraw all 2000-rupee note in circulation by September 2023.

links.text: -Dugal, Ira; Ahmed, Aftab (2023-05-20). "India to withdraw 2,000-rupee notes from circulation". Reuters. Retrieved 2023-05-23.-

Data.event_text: The New Parliament House in New Delhi is inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
2023 Manipur violence 33 tribal militants are killed by soldiers during an operation in Manipur, following ethnic clashes in the region.

links.text: -Hussain, Zarir (2023-05-28). "Around 33 tribal militants killed in clashes in India's Manipur -minister". Reuters. Retrieved 2023-05-30.-

Data.event_text: 29 May  CSK defeats GT in the 2023 Indian Premier League final by 5 wickets.
30 May  Ten Vaishno Devi pilgrims are killed and 57 others are injured as a bus falls from a bridge in Jammu and Kashmir.

2 June  2023 Odisha train collision train number 12841 Coromandel Express running at 130 km/h (81 mph) collides with a freight train (Goods Train) in Odisha's Balasore district. The accident happened around 1930 IST near Bahanaga Bazar station when the train was on the way to Chennai Central from Shalimar railway station near Kolkata. More than 20 coaches were derailed. Over 900 were injured and more than 280+ people have been reported to have been killed. Train number 12864 SMVT BengaluruHowrah SF Express travelling towards Howrah at 130 km/h (81 mph) hit the derailed coaches of the Coromandel Express and ended up derailing 8 of its own coaches. A total of three trains were involved in this disaster.
17 June  At least 96 people die during a heat wave, which began two days before, in the states of Uttar Pradesh and Bihar.

links.text: -"Nearly 100 die as India struggles with a sweltering heat wave in 2 most populous states". AP NEWS. 2023-06-18. Retrieved 2023-06-19.-

Data.event_text: 2023 Maharashtra bus accident 26 bus passengers die when a bus catches fire on Samruddhi Expressway in Buldhana, Maharashtra.

links.text: -"26 bus passengers charred to death after vehicle catches fire on Samruddhi Expressway in Maharashtra". The Hindu. 2023-07-01. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 2023-07-01.-
-"26 bus passengers charred to death after vehicle catches fire on Samruddhi Expressway in Maharashtra". The Hindu. 2023-07-01. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 2023-07-01.-

Data.event_text: The state of Uttar Pradesh is struck by a severe heat wave, leading to at least 121 deaths in two cities. The scorching temperatures have resulted in heat stroke and other related conditions, causing widespread distress and casualties among the affected population.

links.text: -"Sweltering heat kills over 120 in northern Indian state: Report". www.aa.com.tr. Retrieved 2023-07-01.-

Data.event_text: 7 July  The CBI arrests three individuals; two engineers and a technician; believed to be responsible for the Odisha train collision.

links.text: -"India police arrest three rail staff over Odisha train disaster". AL JAZEERA.-

Data.event_text: 12 July  2023 North India floods Heavy rain and flash floods kill at least 41 people in Himachal Pradesh and Punjab.

links.text: -"At least 41 dead after heavy rain and flash floods in northern India". CNN.-

Data.event_text: 18 July  26 parties for I.N.D.I.A alliance to fight against NDA alliance in the upcoming general elections.

links.text: -"Nitish Kumar was not on board with INDIA name as...:'If all of you are okay'". Hindustan Times. 2023-07-19. Retrieved 2023-07-19.-

Data.event_text: A power transformer explodes at the Namami Gange project site in Uttarakhand, leaving 15 dead and 7 injured.

links.text: -"Uttarakhand: 15 killed after power transformer explodes in Chamoli, 'have called for magisterial inquiry,' says CM". The Indian Express. 2023-07-19. Retrieved 2023-07-19.-

Data.event_text: 5 suspected terrorists are arrested by CCB in Bangalore, said to have planned a bombing in Bangalore.

links.text: -"Major terror plot averted in Bengaluru, 5 suspects arrested". The Times of India. 2023-07-19. ISSN 0971-8257. Retrieved 2023-07-19.-
-"Major terror plot averted in Bengaluru, 5 suspects arrested". The Times of India. 2023-07-19. ISSN 0971-8257. Retrieved 2023-07-19.-

Data.event_text: 20 July  2023 Manipur violence A video of two women being paraded naked on the streets and subjected to blatant acts of sexual assault and gang rape by a group of tribal men in Manipur goes viral, triggering outrage across the country. According to reports, the incident happened on 4 May.

links.text: -"Manipur police arrests main culprit in 'shameful' incident of parading 2 tribal women naked, CM Biren Singh says - the Economic Times". The Economic Times. 20 July 2023.-

Data.event_text: 2023 Jaipur Express killings constable Chetan Singh kills his superior and three civilians due to ill mental health.

links.text: -"RPF constable who killed 4 on board Jaipur-Mumbai Express dismissed from service". The Times of India. 16 August 2023.-

Data.event_text: 2023 Haryana riots break out across Nuh district.

links.text: -"Who is Monu Manesar and how is he linked to Haryana communal clashes". India Today. August 2023. Retrieved 2023-08-03.-

Data.event_text: 2 August  Rajya Sabha passes the Forest Conservation Act Amendment Bill, which allows diversion of forest land for security and strategic purposes, amid an opposition walk-out over the ongoing violence in Manipur.

links.text: -Das, Puja (2023-08-02). "Rajya Sabha passes Forest Conservation (Amendment) Bill". mint. Retrieved 2023-08-03.-

Data.event_text: 4 August  The controversial Delhi Ordinance Bill, which gives power to the central government on appointments and transfers of officials of National Capital, is passed in the Rajya Sabha.

links.text: -"Delhi Ordinance Bill passed in Rajya Sabha, receives support from 131 MPs". mint. 2023-08-07. Retrieved 2023-08-23.-

Data.event_text: 4 August - An 18 year old NEET aspirant dies by suicide in Kota, Rajasthan leaving behind a suicide note.

links.text: -"Happy Birthday Papa': Kota student in suicide note, told friends 'I'm next in line'". INDIA TODAY. 4 August 2023. Retrieved 6 February 2025.-
-"'Happy Birthday Papa,' wrote Kota student in heartbreaking suicide note". Business Today. 4 August 2023. Retrieved 6 February 2025.-

Data.event_text: 7 August  Rahul Gandhi's membership in the Lok Sabha is reinstated following the Supreme Court of India accepting his plea & staying conviction.

links.text: -Sinha, Shishir (2023-08-07). "Rahul Gandhi back in Lok Sabha". www.thehindubusinessline.com. Retrieved 2023-09-02.-

Data.event_text: 11 August  Narendra Modi's government wins a no confidence motion, tabled by the I.N.D.I.A alliance.

links.text: -"No-confidence motion: Modi govt wins trust test". The Economic Times. 2023-08-11. ISSN 0013-0389. Retrieved 2023-08-23.-
-"No-confidence motion: Modi govt wins trust test". The Economic Times. 2023-08-11. ISSN 0013-0389. Retrieved 2023-08-23.-

Data.event_text: 14 August  Ashoka University accepts the resignation of assistant professor Sabyasachi Das, who authored a paper taking a critical stance against the Bharatiya Janata Party's electoral victory in the 2019 Indian general election.

links.text: -"Author of 'Democratic backsliding' paper quits Ashoka University". The Hindu. 2023-08-14. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 2023-09-02.-
-"Author of 'Democratic backsliding' paper quits Ashoka University". The Hindu. 2023-08-14. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 2023-09-02.-

Data.event_text: 23 August  Chandrayaan-3 becomes the first space mission to land near the Lunar south pole.

links.text: -"India makes historic landing near Moon's south pole". BBC News. 2023-08-23. Retrieved 2023-08-23.-

Data.event_text: 28 August - At least 2 students died by suicide in Kota, Rajasthan in 4 hours which is one of the highest number of student suicides recorded in a single day.

links.text: -"2 Suicides Within 4 Hours: Age Bar Must For Kota Coaching, Doctor Says". NDTV. 2023-08-28. Retrieved 2023-08-28.-
-"Kota Student Suicide: Two More Students Die By Suicide In Rajasthan's Kota". INDIA TV. 2023-08-28. Retrieved 2023-08-28.-

Data.event_text: 29 August  Government of India reduces the price of domestic liquefied petroleum gas by 200 rupees.

links.text: -"As elections near, LPG price is slashed by Rs 200 a cylinder". The Indian Express. 2023-08-29. Retrieved 2023-09-02.-

Data.event_text: 31 August  The OCCRP releases a report alleging that Vinod Adani committed insider trading through offshore entities in the Adani Group and the Securities and Exchange Board of India committed perjury in investigation against the group.

links.text: -Bose, Prasenjit (2023-08-31). "Explained | Decoding the OCCRP's Adani report". The Hindu. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 2023-09-02.-
-Bose, Prasenjit (2023-08-31). "Explained | Decoding the OCCRP's Adani report". The Hindu. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 2023-09-02.-

Data.event_text: 1 September  Clashes between Maharashtra Police and Maratha reservation agitators at Jalna, Maharashtra following indefinite hunger strike by Manoj Jarange-Patil.

links.text: -Chitnis, Purva (2023-09-02). "FIR against 250 after Maharashtra cops clash with Maratha quota agitators, Oppn slams lathi charge". ThePrint. Retrieved 2023-09-11.-

Data.event_text: 2 September  India launches Aditya-L1, its first solar observation mission to observe the solar corona, photosphere, and chromosphere and to study solar winds and solar flares, and their effect on Earth and near-space weather.

links.text: -"Aditya-L1: India successfully launches its first mission of the Sun". BBC News. 2023-09-01. Retrieved 2023-09-03.-

Data.event_text: CNN reports that president Droupadi Murmu and prime minister Narendra Modi using the term of Bharat instead of India name in connection with a G20 gathering, leading to speculating on a possible name change for the country.
13 September  2023 Anantnag encounter
20 September  Lok Sabha passes the bill with 454 votes in favour and two against.
21 September  The Rajya Sabha passes the bill unanimously with 214 votes in favour and none against.
28   President Murmu signs the bill.
28 September  2023 Manipur violence More than 80 people are injured during riots during protests over the murder of two Meitei students in Manipur.

links.text: -"Curfew in parts of India's Manipur after protests over killing of students". www.aljazeera.com. Retrieved 2023-09-29.-

Data.event_text: At least 14 people are killed and 100 others are missing after a cloudburst causes severe flooding in Sikkim.

links.text: -Regan, Helen; Sharma, Akanksha; Farooqui, Sania (2023-10-05). "Glacial lake bursts in India leaving 100 missing and 19 dead". CNN. Retrieved 2023-10-09.-

Data.event_text: The Lhonak Lake bursts its banks, causing major flooding and impacting 22,000 people. It its the worst such disaster in the region in over 50 years.

links.text: -Choudhury, Subrata Nag; Dash, Jatindra (2023-10-05). "Himalayan lake flooding in India kills 18, nearly 100 missing". Reuters. Retrieved 2023-10-09.-

Data.event_text: Large parts of the Teesta Dam are washed away, with multiple large bridges also being destroyed.

links.text: -"Zoektocht naar meer dan honderd vermisten in Indiase deelstaat Sikkim". nos.nl (in Dutch). 2023-10-05. Retrieved 2023-10-09.-

Data.event_text: 9 October  The death toll of the floods in Sikkim, Northeast India, rises to 74.

links.text: -"Meer lichamen gevonden na overstromingen en dijkdoorbraak India, 74 doden". nos.nl (in Dutch). 2023-10-09. Retrieved 2023-10-09.-

Data.event_text: 17 October  The Supreme Court of India refuses to legalize same-sex marriage saying it is up to parliament.

links.text: -"India's Supreme Court refuses to legalize same-sex marriage, saying it's up to Parliament". AP News. 2023-10-17. Retrieved 2023-10-17.-

Data.event_text: Kalamassery convention centre bombing An IED explodes at a Jehovah's Witnesses' prayer meeting at the Zamra International Convention Center in Kalamassery, Kerala, killing six people and wounding 36 others.

links.text: -"Explosive device blows up at convention center in south India killing at least one and wounding 36". AP News. 2023-10-29. Retrieved 2023-10-29.-

Data.event_text: 2023 Andhra Pradesh train collision On 29  at around 7pm a moving Visakhapatnam-Rayagada passenger train derailed after colliding with the Visakhapatnam-Palasa passenger train near Kottavalasa Junction railway station in Vizianagaram district, Andhra Pradesh killing at least 13 and injuring 50.

links.text: -"At least 13 dead, 50 injured as 2 passenger trains collide in Andhra Pradesh". The Times of India. 30 October 2023.-

Data.event_text: 7 November  Legislative Assemble elections for Mizoram and Phase-I elections for Chhattisgarh was held.

15 November  2023 Doda bus accident A bus carrying passengers slides off the road and falls down a 300-foot valley in Doda district, Jammu and Kashmir, killing at least 39 people and injuring 19 others.

links.text: -"39 killed, 17 injured as bus falls into deep gorge in JK's Doda; PM announces ex-gratia". The Times of India. 2023-11-15. ISSN 0971-8257. Retrieved 2023-11-16.-
-"39 killed, 17 injured as bus falls into deep gorge in JK's Doda; PM announces ex-gratia". The Times of India. 2023-11-15. ISSN 0971-8257. Retrieved 2023-11-16.-

Data.event_text: 19 November  2023 Cricket World Cup final India loses to Australia in the final match of the 2023 Cricket World Cup.
29 November - Uttarakhand tunnel rescue 41 construction workers are rescued from a road tunnel collapse after being trapped for more than two weeks.

links.text: -"All 41 workers pulled out of Indian tunnel collapse". 29 November 2023.-

Data.event_text: 1 December - At least 26 students died by suicide in Kota, Rajasthan which is one of the highest ever in history.

links.text: -"26th NEET suicide in Kota: 22-yr-old hangs self in hostel". The Times of India. Retrieved 2024-12-28.-
-"Year Of Highest Student Suicides In Kota, Many Steps To Prevent Them". NDTV India. 2023-12-31. Retrieved 2023-12-31.-

Data.event_text: 34 December - Election results for five states declared - BJP wins Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh and Chhattisgarh, INC wins Telangana and ZPM wins Mizoram.

13 December - 2023 Indian Parliament breach Two individuals entered the Lok Sabha chamber from the public gallery. One of the individuals jumped onto the tables where the Members of Parliament (MPs) were seated and released a yellow-colored smoke canister. The other individual allegedly chanted slogans. This caused chaos and panic within the house, leading to the immediate adjournment of the session. Two other individuals were detained outside the building.
17 December - Nine workers are killed and three others are injured in an explosion at a factory in Nagpur district, Maharashtra.

links.text: -"9 workers killed, 3 injured in blast at fire factory in western India". www.aa.com.tr. Retrieved 2023-12-18.-

Data.event_text: 19 December - 2023 Indian Parliament breach 49 Lok Sabha MPs are suspended from parliament for taking part in protests relating to a security breach in parliament, bringing the total number of suspensions to 141, 95 from the Lok Sabha, and 46 from the Rajya Sabha.

links.text: -"Parliament winter session: India opposition fury as 141 MPs suspended". 2023-12-19. Retrieved 2023-12-20.-

Data.event_text: 21 December - Four Indian soldiers are killed and three others are injured after gunmen opened fire against two army vehicles in Jammu and Kashmir.

links.text: -"4 Indian soldiers killed and 3 wounded in an ambush by rebels in disputed Kashmir". AP News. 2023-12-21. Retrieved 2023-12-22.-

Data.event_text: 23 December - Locals in Indian-controlled Kashmir say the Indian Army tortured three detainees to death, with five other surviving detainees reporting that they were also subjected to torture.

links.text: -"Anger in remote parts of Indian-controlled Kashmir after 3 are killed while in army custody". AP News. 2023-12-23. Retrieved 2023-12-24.-

Data.event_text: 28 December - At least 13 people are killed when a bus catches fire after colliding head-on with a truck on a highway in Guna district, Madhya Pradesh.

links.text: -"13 dead as bus catches fire after colliding with dumper in Madhya Pradesh's Guna". India Today. 28 December 2023. Retrieved 2023-12-28.-
